alert.note: Alert for Marion; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MARION AND SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Springfield, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Springfield, Bradfordsville, Rineltown, Briartown, Poplar Corner, Pleasant Grove, Simstown, Cisselville and Thompsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
